org.apache.hawq.pxf.plugins.hive

Class HiveAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hawq.pxf.api.utilities.Plugin
      • org.apache.hawq.pxf.plugins.hdfs.HdfsSplittableDataAccessor
        • org.apache.hawq.pxf.plugins.hive.HiveAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadAccessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HiveLineBreakAccessor, HiveRCFileAccessor

    public class HiveAccessor
extends HdfsSplittableDataAccessor
    Accessor for Hive tables. The accessor will open and read a split belonging to a Hive table. Opening a split means creating the corresponding InputFormat and RecordReader required to access the split's data. The actual record reading is done in the base class - HdfsSplittableDataAccessor.
    HiveAccessor will also enforce Hive partition filtering by filtering-out a split which does not belong to a partition filter. Naturally, the partition filtering will be done only for Hive tables that are partitioned.

    • Method Detail

      • openForRead

        public boolean openForRead()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Opens Hive data split for read. Enables Hive partition filtering.
        Specified by:
        openForRead in interface ReadAccessor
        Overrides:
        openForRead in class HdfsSplittableDataAccessor
        Returns:
        true if there are no partitions or there is no partition filter or partition filter is set and the file currently opened by the accessor belongs to the partition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if filter could not be built, connection to Hive failed or resource failed to open
